exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

REQUIRED_FIELDS = ['email']¶
USERNAME_FIELD = 'username'¶
auth_token_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

date_joined¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

email¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

route¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

api.urls module¶

api.views module¶

api.views.add_Host(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to add Hosts in the Hosts table, it will assign the tunnel IP to the host being added, first looking for tunnel IP in the CacheTable, if not found, An unused IP will assigned from the TunnelPool Table, if host being added is a HUB then its NBMA and tunnel IP will also be added to Defaults Table end point -> /api/add-host/

api.views.add_remove_hub(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to Add or Remove the Hub (other than Primary Hub) individually. Along removing or adding configuration to new Hub , change in converged across other Hubs and spokes i.e Add/remove nhrp static mapping & BGP neighborship commands

api.views.add_remove_spoke(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to add/remove a indivisual spoke endpoint -> ‘api/branch/<str:pk>/’

api.views.check_alive(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to test the ssh connectivity of the hosts endpoind -> ‘api/ping/’

api.views.configure(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to configure the network with dmvpn, the ‘option’( int-> 1,2 or 3) argument will be passed to the configuration function to configure the access type of the network as demanded by the user. endpoint -> /api/configure/<int:option>/

api.views.copp(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
View for configuring Control Plane Policing on Cisco devices

  • check max throughput from model_spec file

  • calculte COPP bandwidth classes and feed to configuration template

api.views.delete_host(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to delete a Host from Database, if host is configured, first, it will be removed from the network

api.views.device_hardening(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View for pushing Hardening Commands to devices

api.views.gather_routes(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
View for suggesting routes to user

  • return list of directly connected & static routes ( GET)

  • for fortigate only returns directly connected ( GET )

  • POST routes back to the Database ( POST )

api.views.get_cdp_info(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function to get CDP information from all the Hosts in the Database Data is then structured to feed the Viz-js library to create Network Topology on front-end

api.views.get_deployed_access_type(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View for getting deployed access type

api.views.get_facts(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to gather the facts about devices 1. Check the device Platform and update Hosts table 2. Gather hostname,interfaces,model,serial_no,os_version ,vendor

api.views.get_interfaces(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View for getting interface information

api.views.get_inventory(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

temporary function to get nornir inventory, for debug and testing purpose endpoint -> /api/inventory/

api.views.ip_sla_conf(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
function to configure ip sla and track in HSRP

endpoind -> ‘api/ip-sla/’

api.views.reachability(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to check the reachability of the hosts endpoind -> ‘api/ping/’

api.views.set_logging(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
api.views.snmp_poll(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View for SNMP polling

api.views.swipe_ipsec_keys(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View For Changing IPsec Keys

api.views.tear_down(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

function to tear down whole network endpoint -> ‘api/tear-down/’
